Dear Ms. Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action. Please review the
enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In the event
that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager at 616-552-3662.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4158 Interventions standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii)Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 threatened to harm Youth I.
Investigation I notified Foster Care Worker that I was assigned this
investigation. She expressed no additional concerns regarding
the facility.
I notified Rights Officer of the allegation on 7/7/23 who stated Staff
1 (contingent) would not work with Youth S pending the outcome
of this investigation. Before an interview could be scheduled,
Quality Manager notified me Staff 1 was terminated on 7/14/23.
I reviewed the facility’s history of licensing rule violations.
I interviewed Youth S with Rights Officer present. On 7/5/23, she
said she was irritated and started throwing the couch cushions
around the wing. “I didn’t know it hit her (Staff 1). She (Staff 1)
said, ‘You just hit me with the couch. This will be the last time kids
hit me. I’ll beat your ass.’”
Youth S admitted, “I like to pick with people, so I kept throwing it at
her. Then I blacked out. Staff 1 walked off the wing, then opened
the door asking me what I said. I tried to go through her, but she
shut the door and walked away.”
I interviewed Staff 2 with Rights Officer present. She has worked
at the facility for three months. Staff 2 said Youth S was escalated
and telling peers she was going to tear up the wing. She picked
up a chair pretending to throw it and threw cushions around. Staff
1 warned Youth S not to hit her. Youth S asked what would
happen if she did. Staff 1 told her she would receive
consequences. “One cushion was thrown her (Staff 1’s) way.
Staff 1 walked up to Youth S as if she was about to hit her, then
stopped herself. Youth S said, ‘I dare you to hit me.’ Staff 1
walked away from the situation. I heard Staff 1 say she would
beat her ass.” Staff 2 eventually left the wing.
2

I interviewed Staff 3 via phone on 7/14/23. She has worked at the
facility for one month. Staff 3 recalled Youth I and Staff 1 going
back and forth verbally. Then at one point, Staff 1 warned Youth I,
“If you throw that cushion at me, I’ll beat your ass.” Staff 3 had no
additional information.
Analysis Staff 1 threatened to harm Youth S after Youth S threw cushions
at her and challenged Staff 1 to hit her.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C0000229 intake 2/8/23; CAP approved 3/28/23.
2023C0000531 intake 6/12/23; CAP pending
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
